The\nuniverse is finished.annotation:
In the middle of a Jane Austen / Schopenhauer inversion, where Ishmael is mentally transforming this shit hole into a cozy niche, 'things could be better, but the universe is finished'.  By itself, seeming nihilistic/deterministic, but in this paragraph refusing to be.  Very strange.  

Biblical, but only a little, or I can't follow the lead.  "It is finished," said Christ on the cross?  An omnipotent creator who has finished designing the universe and now leaves it for others to navigate

Could reflect Melville's perspective on the industrial revolution and scientific discoveries of his era, which seemed to "complete" or define the universe in new, limiting ways.

Sociopolitical reflection of Melville's concern about the oppressive aspects of societal norms and conventions, signifying a completed, rigid system from which one might yearn to escape, as Ishmael is. 

Or is it a more straightforward setup of irony of Ishmael's underestimation of the unpredictable, chaotic elements in the universe/sea.

Alfred the Great, who, with his own roya.annotation: Around 890 AD, first mention of Denmark as well.

Euroclydon kept up a worse howling than.annotation: Euroclydon goes from an exaggerated depiction of weather hitting the house to inversion.

the Sperm Whale, a Platonian.annotation: The Sperm Whale and Ahab, Platonists both.

All visible objects, man,\nare but as pa.annotation:
Ahab reveals his goal, is Platonic worldview, and the fusion of his hate for each. 
 
GPT4:  He aims to strike through these masks or walls to confront and 
challenge the underlying forces—potentially divine, inscrutable—causing 
his suffering.

Heidelburgh Tun.annotation: an extremely large wine vat contained within the cellars of Heidelberg Castle

true and faithful repentance;\nnot clamo.annotation: the moral of Jonah, god wishes gratitude for punishment

Over Descartian vortices you hover..annotation: disproven at the time?  don't think so

Here, then, was this grey-headed, ungodl.annotation: unaided virtue, invulnerable jollity, and mediocrity

metempsychosis.annotation: The supposed transmigration at death of the soul of a human being or animal into a new body of the same or a different species.

The intense concentration of self in the.annotation: The foremost issue with being a castaway is to have to be with ones self?

The Sermon.annotation: There are at least three sermons:  Jonah by the naval preacher, Ahab to the crew, the cook to the sharks.

how immaterial are all\nmaterials!.annotation: More direct Ahab Platonizing.  Seems valid for comparison to Don Quixote, where Quixote's contrast of the realist and idealist are more even handed.

Is Ahab, Ahab?.annotation: Descends into a bit of de-personalization upon questioning himself.

in their life-time\naggregate a whole ag.annotation: Would Pythagoras have spoken like this?

Heed them not! those teeth but give new.annotation: What serene hell have these people sailed to?
